content.p: Introduction to Bahasa Malaysia A will run during the Spring semester of 2016. There will be no level B class this semester. This module introduces the basic structure of the language through topics related to social and everyday life in the countries where the target language is spoken. You will acquire the four skills of listening, speaking, reading and writing together with basic grammatical structures which will enable you to use the language for basic communication. You will attend an one and a half-hour weekly evening class over eight weeks. The course will run at 12:00 on Wednesdays in B1C24 starting from 15 February 2017. You will also be expected to undertake a minimum of two hoursâ€™ self study per week in order to develop their linguistic skills effectively. Work in class is communicative with regular opportunities for pair and group work. For more information please contact Natrah Noor.
